data.text: What Do You Eat Right Before a Long Bicycle Ride?
What do you eat right before a long ride?

An apple pie pastry, a Clif bar and a banana. Then honey stinger waffles, Clif bars, and skratch labs gummies during the ride, unless it's over 6 hours, then I'll stop for a real meal somewhere along the way.
data.author: Kenneth Rieck

data.text: I start eating right after I start riding for a long ride. Develop a schedule for yourself and aim for 40-60g of carbohydrate per hour for starters. The research shows that a pre-ride meal should be a few hours before you start riding to allow insulin levels to moderate.
data.author: Hemanth Shenoi

data.text:
Here is a good article to read if you want to learn more: https://www.trainingpeaks.com/blog/body-actually-needs-different-types-endurance-exercise/
What Your Body Actually Needs During Different Types of Endurance Exercise
trainingpeaks.com
data.author: Hemanth Shenoi

data.text: Nothing because the adrenaline makes my stomach go bonkers so while i am riding i drink lots of electrolytes and eat easily digestible foods like granola bars stinger Waffles chews and beef jerky. Then toward end of ride stop for a meal.

data.text: Nothing for a ride, normally. But, so many variables. If it‚Äôs a 90-120 minute race, I don‚Äôt eat for three hours prior. If it‚Äôs just a 2 hour ride, nothing really matters. Longer rides, at lower intensity, carbs, before and during. Candy bars work well.

data.text: After being paleo for 8 years my body is pretty much ‚Äúfat adapted‚Äù as an energy source, rather than carbohydrates. When I ride the bike a lot I consume good quality carbohydrates especially during and immediately after strenuous activity. In the morning before I have my daily ‚ÄúBulletproof coffee‚Äù concoction (butter, MCT, primal fuel, etc.) the right before my ride I like a couple of GF Waffels with nut butter and a banana.
data.author: Mark Jake Jacobson

data.text: same. I have a packet of ultra fat and then some salt as I go.
data.author: Murphy Wethammer

data.text: Coffee with HWCream. Or take a bite of CliffBar. I‚Äôm also fat adapted for almost 10yrs now and used to roll out fasted.
data.author: Angelo Capistrano

data.text: How long can you go until re-fueling? I eat dates, almonds and walnuts, every 45 minutes I‚Äôll refuel. Can go most of the day with just that.
data.author: Craig Robinson

data.text: Donuts!
data.author: Friedrich Cody

data.text: I live right around the corner from a local donut shop that opens at 3:30am. Not cheap, crummy store-bought donuts; a 3-generation family operation.
data.author: Don Huber

data.text: I eat two pieces of whole wheat toast with almond butter and a little local honey about an hour before the ride. Then, a fun size Payday candy bar every hour (a tip from a former Army Team Triathlete) for anything under 4 hours and Skratch in my bottles. Longer than that, a PB&J every 3 hours with paydays in between.
data.author: Jason Geer

data.text: Check out Hammer Nutritions plans. They make sense and changed everything for me big time. Go in fasted if you ride early, fuel in the saddle. Or eat 3 hours before to give you time to digest and then fuel and hydrate during the ride.
